title: Steamed Tomatoes
introduction: Steamed tomatoes are a simple yet delightful dish where sweet little tomatoes are cooked in their own juices. Perfect as a side dish for meat or fish, or even as a savory topping for a frittata. If the tomatoes are not sweet enough for your taste, a pinch of sugar can be added during cooking.
ingredients: 6 basil leaves, stacked and cut into narrow strips
instructions: Rinse the tomatoes and pat dry. Cut them in half through the stem end. In a small saucepan, combine the tomatoes, oil, and salt. Cover the pan and place on low heat. Cook 10 minutes or until the tomatoes are just softened but still hold their shape.
Add the basil. Serve hot or at room temperature.
